source:
# Titanic EDA and Classification Project (TOP %5) Content of The Titanic Exploratory Data Analysis 1. [Chapter-1 Data Load and Check](#1) * [1-Outlier Detection](#2) * [2-Joining Test and Train Data](#3) * [3-Feature Check](#4) 1. [Chapter-2 Data Analysis](#5) * [1-Feature Analysis](#6) * [2-Correlation Between Feature](#7) 1. [Chapter-3 Missing Value](#8) * [1-Find Missing Value](#9) * [2-Fill Missing Value](#10) 1. [Chapter-4 Data Engineering](#11) * [1-New Feature](#12) * [2-Drop Feature](#13) * [3-One Hot Encoding](#14) 1. [Chapter-5 Modeling](#16) * [1-Train-Test Split](#17) * [2-Classification Methods](#18) * [3-Ensemble Modeling](#19) * [4-Result](#20)
# Chapter:1 Data Load And Check import numpy as np import pandas as pd import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import seaborn as sns from collections import Counter import warnings warnings.filterwarnings("ignore") from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, LabelEncoder import os for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'): for filename in filenames: print(os.path.join(dirname, filename)) train_data = pd.read_csv("../input/titanic/train.csv") test_data = pd.read_csv("../input/titanic/test.csv") train_data.columns train_data.head() train_data.info()
## 1-Outlier Detection ![oie_384549KoGQkTap.png](attachment:oie_384549KoGQkTap.png) * Q1 = 1.Quartile 25% * Q2 = 2.Quartile 50% (median) * Q3 = 3.Quartile 75% * IQR = Q3 - Q1 * Outlier data = (Q1 - 1.5 IQR ) U (Q3 + 1.5 IQR) train_data.describe() def outlier_detect(feature, data): outlier_index = [] for each in feature: Q1 = np.percentile(data[each], 25) Q3 = np.percentile(data[each], 75) IQR = Q3 - Q1 min_quartile = Q1 - 1.5*IQR max_quartile = Q3 + 1.5*IQR outlier_list = data[(data[each] < min_quartile) | (data[each] > max_quartile)].index outlier_index.extend(outlier_list) outlier_index = Counter(outlier_index) #If there are three or more outlier data features we must delete them. (n) outlier_data = list(i for i, n in outlier_index.items() if n > 3) return outlier_data outlier_data = outlier_detect(["Age","SibSp","Parch","Fare"], train_data) train_data.loc[outlier_data] train_data = train_data.drop(outlier_data, axis=0).reset_index(drop=True)
## 2-Combining Train and Test Data * Train_data and test_data are combined so that data is obtained. data = pd.concat([train_data, test_data], axis=0).reset_index(drop=True)
## 3-Feature Analysis Object 1. Name : 1. Sex : male and female 1. Ticket : ticket number 1. Cabin : cabin category 1. Embarked : port C, Q and S Int64 1. PassengerId : unique id number 1. Survived : 0 -> died ,1-> survived 1. Pclasss : 1, 2 and 3 1. SibSp : number of siblings/spouse 1. Parch : number of parent/children Float64 1. Age : age of passenger 1. Fare : price of the ticket ### Survived sns.countplot('Survived',data=train_data ) data.describe()
# Chapter:2 Data Analysis * Feature Analysis * Corelation Between Features
## 1- Feature Analysis * Sex - Survived * Pclass - Survived * Embarked - Survived * SibSp - Survived * Parch - Survived * Age - Survived * Fare - Survived ### Sex - Survived Female are more likely to survive than male. data[["Sex", "Survived"]].groupby(["Sex"], as_index = False).mean() sns.factorplot(x="Sex", y ="Survived", data=data, kind="bar", size=3) plt.show() ### Pclass - Survived sns.factorplot(x="Pclass", y ="Survived", data=data, kind="bar", size=3) plt.show() ### Embarked - Survived sns.factorplot(x="Embarked", y ="Survived", data=data, kind="bar", size=3) plt.show() ### SibSp - Survived sns.factorplot(x="SibSp", y ="Survived", data=data, kind="bar", size=3) plt.show() ### Parch - Survived sns.factorplot(x="Parch", y ="Survived", data=data, kind="bar", size=3) plt.show() ### Age - Survived g = sns.FacetGrid(data, row="Survived") g.map(sns.distplot, "Age", bins=25) plt.show() ### Fare - Survived g = sns.FacetGrid(data, row="Survived") g.map(sns.distplot, "Fare", bins=25) plt.show()
## 2-Correlation Between Features #data["Sex"] = [0 if i == "male" else 1 for i in data["Sex"]] data['Sex'].replace(['male','female'],[0,1],inplace=True) data['Embarked'].replace(['S','C','Q'],[0,1,2],inplace=True) # male: 0, famela: 1 sns.heatmap(data[["Age","Sex","SibSp","Parch","Pclass","Fare","Embarked", "Survived"]].corr(), annot = True) plt.show() **Outcome** * Sex, Pclass, Fare and Embarked are associated with Survived.
# Chapter-3 Missing Value * Find Missing Value * Fill Missing Value
## 1-Find Missing Value * Age, Fare and Cabin have missing value. Therefore we are looking at the correlation matrix. Correlation Matrix * Pclass is associated with Fare. * Embarked is not associated with any feature. * Pclass and SibSp are associated with Age. data.columns[data.isnull().any()] data.isnull().sum()
## 2-Fill Missing Value * Cabin has 1007 missing value * Age has 256 missing value * Embarked has 2 missing value * Fare has 1 missing value Not: Survived has 418 missing value (only test value) ### Fare Fill Value Pclass is associated with Fare. data[data["Fare"].isnull()] data["Fare"] = data["Fare"].fillna(np.mean(data[((data["Pclass"]==3) & (data["Embarked"]==0))]["Fare"])) data[data["Fare"].isnull()] ### Embarked Fill Value Embarked is not associated with any feature. S = 0, C = 1 and Q = 2 data[data["Embarked"].isnull()] data["Embarked"] = data["Embarked"].fillna(1) data[data["Embarked"].isnull()] ### Age Fill Value Pclass and SibSp are associated with Age. data[data["Age"].isnull()] data_age_nan_index = data[data["Age"].isnull()].index for i in data_age_nan_index: mean_age = data["Age"][(data["Pclass"]==data.iloc[i]["Pclass"])].median() data["Age"].iloc[i] = mean_age
# Chapter-4 Data Engineering * New Feature * Edit Feature * Drop Feature * Normalization
## 1-New - Feature * Alone and Family * Title (Name) * Age Limit * Fare Limit ### Alone and Family * SibSp + Parch = family data["Family"] = data["SibSp"] + data["Parch"] sns.factorplot(x="Family", y ="Survived", data=data, kind="bar", size=3) plt.show() data["Alone"] = [1 if i == 0 else 0 for i in data["Family"]] data["Family"].replace([0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,10], [0,1,1,1,0,2,0,2,2], inplace=True) data.head() ### Name - Title data['Title']=data.Name.str.extract('([A-Za-z]+)\.') sns.countplot(data["Title"]) plt.xticks(rotation = 90) plt.show() data['Title'].replace(['Mme','Ms','Mlle','Lady','Countess','Dona','Dr','Major','Sir','Capt','Don','Rev','Col', 'Jonkheer'],['Miss','Miss','Miss','Mrs','Mrs','Mrs','Mr','Mr','Mr','Mr','Mr','Other','Other','Other'], inplace=True) sns.countplot(data["Title"]) plt.show() sns.factorplot(x="Title", y ="Survived", data=data, kind="bar", size=3) plt.show() data["Title"].replace(["Mr","Mrs","Miss","Master","Other"], [1,2,2,3,1], inplace=True) ### Age Limit data['Age_Limit']=pd.cut(data['Age'], 5) data.groupby(['Age_Limit'])['Survived'].mean().to_frame().style.background_gradient(cmap='summer_r') data['Age_Limit'] = LabelEncoder().fit_transform(data['Age_Limit']) ### Fare Limit data['Fare_Limit']=pd.qcut(data['Fare'],4) data.groupby(['Fare_Limit'])['Survived'].mean().to_frame().style.background_gradient(cmap='summer_r') data['Fare_Limit'] = LabelEncoder().fit_transform(data['Fare_Limit']) sns.factorplot(x="Fare_Limit", y ="Survived", data=data, kind="bar", size=3) plt.show() ### Correlation Matrix sns.heatmap(data[["Cabin","Pclass","Embarked","Sex","Age","Age_Limit","Fare_Limit", "Title","Family", "Survived"]].corr(), annot = True) plt.show()
## 2- Drop Features * Ticket, Cabin, Name, PassengerId and Age are deleted according to the result of the correlation matrix. data['Age']=data['Age'].astype(int) data.drop(labels=["SibSp","Parch","Cabin","Fare","Age", "Ticket", "Name", "PassengerId"], axis=1, inplace = True) data.head()
## 3 - One Hot Encoding data = pd.get_dummies(data,columns=["Pclass"]) data = pd.get_dummies(data,columns=["Embarked"]) data = pd.get_dummies(data,columns=["Family"]) data = pd.get_dummies(data,columns=["Age_Limit"]) data = pd.get_dummies(data,columns=["Fare_Limit"]) data = pd.get_dummies(data,columns=["Title"]) data.head()
# Chapter:5 Modeling from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier, VotingClassifier from sklearn.neighbors import KNeighborsClassifier from sklearn.svm import SVC
## 1-Train Test Split if len(data) == (len(train_data) + len(test_data)): print("success") test = data[len(train_data):] test.drop(labels="Survived", axis=1, inplace=True) train = data[:len(train_data)] X_train = train.drop(labels = "Survived", axis=1) y_train = train["Survived"] X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X_train, y_train, test_size=0.3, random_state=42)
## 2-Classificaiton Methods * Logistic Regression * Random Forest Regression * Support Vector Machine (SVM) * K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN) ### Logistic Regression log_reg = LogisticRegression(random_state=42) log_reg.fit(X_train, y_train) print("Accuracy: ", log_reg.score(X_test,y_test)) ### Random Forest Regression rf_reg = RandomForestClassifier(random_state=42) rf_reg.fit(X_train, y_train) print("Accuracy: ", rf_reg.score(X_test,y_test)) ### Support Vector Machine (SVM) svm_clsf = SVC() svm_clsf.fit(X_train, y_train) print("Accuracy: ", svm_clsf.score(X_test,y_test)) ### KNN elbow -> n:8 (the article will be updated) best_knn = [] for n in range(1,12): knn = KNeighborsClassifier(n_neighbors=n) knn.fit(X_train, y_train) best_knn.insert(n, knn.score(X_test,y_test)) best_knn knn_clsf = KNeighborsClassifier(n_neighbors=8) knn_clsf.fit(X_train, y_train) print("Accuracy: ", knn_clsf.score(X_test,y_test))
## 3- Ensemble Modeling voting_classfication = VotingClassifier(estimators = [('knn', knn_clsf),('lg', log_reg), ('rfg', rf_reg), ('svc', svm_clsf)], voting="hard", n_jobs=-1) voting_classfication.fit(X_train, y_train) print("Accuracy: ", voting_classfication.score(X_test,y_test))
## 4-Result We choose the ensemble model because it works best. test_result = pd.Series(voting_classfication.predict(test), name = "Survived").astype(int) results = pd.concat([test_data["PassengerId"], test_result],axis = 1) results.to_csv("titanic_submission.csv", index = False)
code_source:
import numpy as np 
import pandas as pd 
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt 
import seaborn as sns  

from collections import Counter

import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")


from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, LabelEncoder

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename)) 
 train_data = pd.read_csv("../input/titanic/train.csv")
test_data = pd.read_csv("../input/titanic/test.csv")


train_data.columns 
 train_data.head() 
 train_data.info() 
 train_data.describe() 
 def outlier_detect(feature, data):
    outlier_index = []

    for each in feature:
        Q1 = np.percentile(data[each], 25)
        Q3 = np.percentile(data[each], 75)
        IQR = Q3 - Q1
        min_quartile = Q1 - 1.5*IQR
        max_quartile = Q3 + 1.5*IQR
        outlier_list = data[(data[each] < min_quartile) | (data[each] > max_quartile)].index
        outlier_index.extend(outlier_list)
        
    outlier_index = Counter(outlier_index)
    #If there are three or more outlier data features we must delete them. (n)
    outlier_data = list(i for i, n in outlier_index.items() if n > 3)
    return outlier_data 
 outlier_data = outlier_detect(["Age","SibSp","Parch","Fare"], train_data)
train_data.loc[outlier_data]
 
 train_data = train_data.drop(outlier_data, axis=0).reset_index(drop=True) 
 data = pd.concat([train_data, test_data], axis=0).reset_index(drop=True) 
 sns.countplot('Survived',data=train_data )
 
 data.describe() 
 data[["Sex", "Survived"]].groupby(["Sex"], as_index = False).mean() 
 sns.factorplot(x="Sex", y ="Survived", data=data, kind="bar", size=3)
plt.show() 
 sns.factorplot(x="Pclass", y ="Survived", data=data, kind="bar", size=3)
plt.show() 
 sns.factorplot(x="Embarked", y ="Survived", data=data, kind="bar", size=3)
plt.show() 
 sns.factorplot(x="SibSp", y ="Survived", data=data, kind="bar", size=3)
plt.show() 
 sns.factorplot(x="Parch", y ="Survived", data=data, kind="bar", size=3)
plt.show() 
 g = sns.FacetGrid(data, row="Survived")
g.map(sns.distplot, "Age", bins=25)
plt.show() 
 g = sns.FacetGrid(data, row="Survived")
g.map(sns.distplot, "Fare", bins=25)
plt.show() 
 #data["Sex"] = [0 if i == "male" else 1 for i in data["Sex"]]
data['Sex'].replace(['male','female'],[0,1],inplace=True)
data['Embarked'].replace(['S','C','Q'],[0,1,2],inplace=True)
# male: 0, famela: 1
sns.heatmap(data[["Age","Sex","SibSp","Parch","Pclass","Fare","Embarked", "Survived"]].corr(), annot = True)
plt.show() 
 data.columns[data.isnull().any()] 
 data.isnull().sum() 
 data[data["Fare"].isnull()] 
 data["Fare"] = data["Fare"].fillna(np.mean(data[((data["Pclass"]==3) & (data["Embarked"]==0))]["Fare"]))
data[data["Fare"].isnull()] 
 data[data["Embarked"].isnull()] 
 data["Embarked"] = data["Embarked"].fillna(1)
data[data["Embarked"].isnull()] 
 data[data["Age"].isnull()] 
 data_age_nan_index = data[data["Age"].isnull()].index
for i in data_age_nan_index:
    mean_age = data["Age"][(data["Pclass"]==data.iloc[i]["Pclass"])].median()
    data["Age"].iloc[i] = mean_age 
 data["Family"] = data["SibSp"] + data["Parch"]
sns.factorplot(x="Family", y ="Survived", data=data, kind="bar", size=3)
plt.show() 
 data["Alone"] = [1 if i == 0 else 0 for i in data["Family"]]
data["Family"].replace([0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,10], [0,1,1,1,0,2,0,2,2], inplace=True)
data.head() 
 data['Title']=data.Name.str.extract('([A-Za-z]+)\.') 
 sns.countplot(data["Title"])
plt.xticks(rotation = 90)
plt.show() 
 data['Title'].replace(['Mme','Ms','Mlle','Lady','Countess','Dona','Dr','Major','Sir','Capt','Don','Rev','Col', 'Jonkheer'],['Miss','Miss','Miss','Mrs','Mrs','Mrs','Mr','Mr','Mr','Mr','Mr','Other','Other','Other'], inplace=True) 
 sns.countplot(data["Title"])
plt.show() 
 sns.factorplot(x="Title", y ="Survived", data=data, kind="bar", size=3)
plt.show() 
 data["Title"].replace(["Mr","Mrs","Miss","Master","Other"], [1,2,2,3,1], inplace=True)
 
 data['Age_Limit']=pd.cut(data['Age'], 5)
data.groupby(['Age_Limit'])['Survived'].mean().to_frame().style.background_gradient(cmap='summer_r') 
 data['Age_Limit'] = LabelEncoder().fit_transform(data['Age_Limit'])
 
 data['Fare_Limit']=pd.qcut(data['Fare'],4)
data.groupby(['Fare_Limit'])['Survived'].mean().to_frame().style.background_gradient(cmap='summer_r') 
 data['Fare_Limit'] = LabelEncoder().fit_transform(data['Fare_Limit'])
 
 sns.factorplot(x="Fare_Limit", y ="Survived", data=data, kind="bar", size=3)
plt.show() 
 sns.heatmap(data[["Cabin","Pclass","Embarked","Sex","Age","Age_Limit","Fare_Limit", "Title","Family", "Survived"]].corr(), annot = True)
plt.show() 
 data['Age']=data['Age'].astype(int)

data.drop(labels=["SibSp","Parch","Cabin","Fare","Age", "Ticket", "Name", "PassengerId"], axis=1, inplace = True)
data.head() 
 data = pd.get_dummies(data,columns=["Pclass"])
data = pd.get_dummies(data,columns=["Embarked"])
data = pd.get_dummies(data,columns=["Family"])
data = pd.get_dummies(data,columns=["Age_Limit"])
data = pd.get_dummies(data,columns=["Fare_Limit"])
data = pd.get_dummies(data,columns=["Title"])

data.head() 
 from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split

from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier, VotingClassifier
from sklearn.neighbors import KNeighborsClassifier
from sklearn.svm import SVC 
 if len(data) == (len(train_data) + len(test_data)):
    print("success") 
 test = data[len(train_data):]
test.drop(labels="Survived", axis=1, inplace=True) 
 train = data[:len(train_data)]
X_train = train.drop(labels = "Survived", axis=1)
y_train = train["Survived"]
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X_train, y_train, test_size=0.3, random_state=42)
 
 log_reg = LogisticRegression(random_state=42)
log_reg.fit(X_train, y_train)
print("Accuracy: ", log_reg.score(X_test,y_test)) 
 rf_reg = RandomForestClassifier(random_state=42)
rf_reg.fit(X_train, y_train)
print("Accuracy: ", rf_reg.score(X_test,y_test)) 
 svm_clsf = SVC()
svm_clsf.fit(X_train, y_train)
print("Accuracy: ", svm_clsf.score(X_test,y_test)) 
 best_knn = []
for n in range(1,12):
    knn = KNeighborsClassifier(n_neighbors=n)
    knn.fit(X_train, y_train)
    best_knn.insert(n, knn.score(X_test,y_test))
best_knn
 
 knn_clsf = KNeighborsClassifier(n_neighbors=8)
knn_clsf.fit(X_train, y_train)
print("Accuracy: ", knn_clsf.score(X_test,y_test)) 
 voting_classfication = VotingClassifier(estimators = [('knn', knn_clsf),('lg', log_reg), ('rfg', rf_reg), ('svc', svm_clsf)], voting="hard", n_jobs=-1)
voting_classfication.fit(X_train, y_train)
print("Accuracy: ", voting_classfication.score(X_test,y_test)) 
 test_result = pd.Series(voting_classfication.predict(test), name = "Survived").astype(int)
results = pd.concat([test_data["PassengerId"], test_result],axis = 1)
results.to_csv("titanic_submission.csv", index = False)

# Titanic EDA and Classification Project (TOP %5) Content of The Titanic Exploratory Data Analysis 1. [Chapter-1 Data Load and Check](#1) * [1-Outlier Detection](#2) * [2-Joining Test and Train Data](#3) * [3-Feature Check](#4) 1. [Chapter-2 Data Analysis](#5) * [1-Feature Analysis](#6) * [2-Correlation Between Feature](#7) 1. [Chapter-3 Missing Value](#8) * [1-Find Missing Value](#9) * [2-Fill Missing Value](#10) 1. [Chapter-4 Data Engineering](#11) * [1-New Feature](#12) * [2-Drop Feature](#13) * [3-One Hot Encoding](#14) 1. [Chapter-5 Modeling](#16) * [1-Train-Test Split](#17) * [2-Classification Methods](#18) * [3-Ensemble Modeling](#19) * [4-Result](#20)
# Chapter:1 Data Load And Check
## 1-Outlier Detection ![oie_384549KoGQkTap.png](attachment:oie_384549KoGQkTap.png) * Q1 = 1.Quartile 25% * Q2 = 2.Quartile 50% (median) * Q3 = 3.Quartile 75% * IQR = Q3 - Q1 * Outlier data = (Q1 - 1.5 IQR ) U (Q3 + 1.5 IQR)
## 2-Combining Train and Test Data * Train_data and test_data are combined so that data is obtained.
## 3-Feature Analysis Object 1. Name : 1. Sex : male and female 1. Ticket : ticket number 1. Cabin : cabin category 1. Embarked : port C, Q and S Int64 1. PassengerId : unique id number 1. Survived : 0 -> died ,1-> survived 1. Pclasss : 1, 2 and 3 1. SibSp : number of siblings/spouse 1. Parch : number of parent/children Float64 1. Age : age of passenger 1. Fare : price of the ticket ### Survived
# Chapter:2 Data Analysis * Feature Analysis * Corelation Between Features
## 1- Feature Analysis * Sex - Survived * Pclass - Survived * Embarked - Survived * SibSp - Survived * Parch - Survived * Age - Survived * Fare - Survived ### Sex - Survived Female are more likely to survive than male. ### Pclass - Survived ### Embarked - Survived ### SibSp - Survived ### Parch - Survived ### Age - Survived ### Fare - Survived
## 2-Correlation Between Features **Outcome** * Sex, Pclass, Fare and Embarked are associated with Survived.
# Chapter-3 Missing Value * Find Missing Value * Fill Missing Value
## 1-Find Missing Value * Age, Fare and Cabin have missing value. Therefore we are looking at the correlation matrix. Correlation Matrix * Pclass is associated with Fare. * Embarked is not associated with any feature. * Pclass and SibSp are associated with Age.
## 2-Fill Missing Value * Cabin has 1007 missing value * Age has 256 missing value * Embarked has 2 missing value * Fare has 1 missing value Not: Survived has 418 missing value (only test value) ### Fare Fill Value Pclass is associated with Fare. ### Embarked Fill Value Embarked is not associated with any feature. S = 0, C = 1 and Q = 2 ### Age Fill Value Pclass and SibSp are associated with Age.
# Chapter-4 Data Engineering * New Feature * Edit Feature * Drop Feature * Normalization
## 1-New - Feature * Alone and Family * Title (Name) * Age Limit * Fare Limit ### Alone and Family * SibSp + Parch = family ### Name - Title ### Age Limit ### Fare Limit ### Correlation Matrix
## 2- Drop Features * Ticket, Cabin, Name, PassengerId and Age are deleted according to the result of the correlation matrix.
## 3 - One Hot Encoding
# Chapter:5 Modeling
## 1-Train Test Split
## 2-Classificaiton Methods * Logistic Regression * Random Forest Regression * Support Vector Machine (SVM) * K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN) ### Logistic Regression ### Random Forest Regression ### Support Vector Machine (SVM) ### KNN elbow -> n:8 (the article will be updated)
## 3- Ensemble Modeling
## 4-Result We choose the ensemble model because it works best.

# Chapter:1 Data Load And Check

import numpy as np 
import pandas as pd 
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt 
import seaborn as sns  

from collections import Counter

import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")


from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, LabelEncoder

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

all_cells.source: ## 1-Outlier Detection ![oie_384549KoGQkTap.png](attachment:oie_384549KoGQkTap.png) * Q1 = 1.Quartile 25% * Q2 = 2.Quartile 50% (median) * Q3 = 3.Quartile 75% * IQR = Q3 - Q1 * Outlier data = (Q1 - 1.5 IQR ) U (Q3 + 1.5 IQR)

def outlier_detect(feature, data):
    outlier_index = []

    for each in feature:
        Q1 = np.percentile(data[each], 25)
        Q3 = np.percentile(data[each], 75)
        IQR = Q3 - Q1
        min_quartile = Q1 - 1.5*IQR
        max_quartile = Q3 + 1.5*IQR
        outlier_list = data[(data[each] < min_quartile) | (data[each] > max_quartile)].index
        outlier_index.extend(outlier_list)
        
    outlier_index = Counter(outlier_index)
    #If there are three or more outlier data features we must delete them. (n)
    outlier_data = list(i for i, n in outlier_index.items() if n > 3)
    return outlier_data

all_cells.source: ## 2-Combining Train and Test Data * Train_data and test_data are combined so that data is obtained.

## 3-Feature Analysis Object 1. Name : 1. Sex : male and female 1. Ticket : ticket number 1. Cabin : cabin category 1. Embarked : port C, Q and S Int64 1. PassengerId : unique id number 1. Survived : 0 -> died ,1-> survived 1. Pclasss : 1, 2 and 3 1. SibSp : number of siblings/spouse 1. Parch : number of parent/children Float64 1. Age : age of passenger 1. Fare : price of the ticket
# Chapter:2 Data Analysis * Feature Analysis * Corelation Between Features
## 1- Feature Analysis * Sex - Survived * Pclass - Survived * Embarked - Survived * SibSp - Survived * Parch - Survived * Age - Survived * Fare - Survived

### Sex - Survived

Female are more likely to survive than male.

#data["Sex"] = [0 if i == "male" else 1 for i in data["Sex"]]

data['Embarked'].replace(['S','C','Q'],[0,1,2],inplace=True)
# male: 0, famela: 1
sns.heatmap(data[["Age","Sex","SibSp","Parch","Pclass","Fare","Embarked", "Survived"]].corr(), annot = True)
plt.show()

**Outcome**    

* Sex, Pclass, Fare and Embarked are associated with Survived.
# Chapter-3 Missing Value * Find Missing Value * Fill Missing Value

## 1-Find Missing Value * Age, Fare and Cabin have missing value. Therefore we are looking at the correlation matrix. Correlation Matrix * Pclass is associated with Fare. * Embarked is not associated with any feature. * Pclass and SibSp are associated with Age.

all_cells.source:
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split

from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier, VotingClassifier
from sklearn.neighbors import KNeighborsClassifier
from sklearn.svm import SVC

train = data[:len(train_data)]
X_train = train.drop(labels = "Survived", axis=1)
y_train = train["Survived"]
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X_train, y_train, test_size=0.3, random_state=42)
## 2-Classificaiton Methods * Logistic Regression * Random Forest Regression * Support Vector Machine (SVM) * K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN)

log_reg = LogisticRegression(random_state=42)
log_reg.fit(X_train, y_train)
print("Accuracy: ", log_reg.score(X_test,y_test))

rf_reg = RandomForestClassifier(random_state=42)
rf_reg.fit(X_train, y_train)
print("Accuracy: ", rf_reg.score(X_test,y_test))

svm_clsf = SVC()
svm_clsf.fit(X_train, y_train)
print("Accuracy: ", svm_clsf.score(X_test,y_test))

### KNN

elbow -> n:8 (the article will be updated)

best_knn = []
for n in range(1,12):
    knn = KNeighborsClassifier(n_neighbors=n)
    knn.fit(X_train, y_train)
    best_knn.insert(n, knn.score(X_test,y_test))
best_knn

knn_clsf = KNeighborsClassifier(n_neighbors=8)
knn_clsf.fit(X_train, y_train)
print("Accuracy: ", knn_clsf.score(X_test,y_test))

voting_classfication = VotingClassifier(estimators = [('knn', knn_clsf),('lg', log_reg), ('rfg', rf_reg), ('svc', svm_clsf)], voting="hard", n_jobs=-1)
voting_classfication.fit(X_train, y_train)
print("Accuracy: ", voting_classfication.score(X_test,y_test))
## 4-Result We choose the ensemble model because it works best.

test_result = pd.Series(voting_classfication.predict(test), name = "Survived").astype(int)
results = pd.concat([test_data["PassengerId"], test_result],axis = 1)
results.to_csv("titanic_submission.csv", index = False)

code_cells.source:
def outlier_detect(feature, data):
    outlier_index = []

    for each in feature:
        Q1 = np.percentile(data[each], 25)
        Q3 = np.percentile(data[each], 75)
        IQR = Q3 - Q1
        min_quartile = Q1 - 1.5*IQR
        max_quartile = Q3 + 1.5*IQR
        outlier_list = data[(data[each] < min_quartile) | (data[each] > max_quartile)].index
        outlier_index.extend(outlier_list)
        
    outlier_index = Counter(outlier_index)
    #If there are three or more outlier data features we must delete them. (n)
    outlier_data = list(i for i, n in outlier_index.items() if n > 3)
    return outlier_data

code_cells.source:
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split

from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier, VotingClassifier
from sklearn.neighbors import KNeighborsClassifier
from sklearn.svm import SVC

train = data[:len(train_data)]
X_train = train.drop(labels = "Survived", axis=1)
y_train = train["Survived"]
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X_train, y_train, test_size=0.3, random_state=42)

log_reg = LogisticRegression(random_state=42)
log_reg.fit(X_train, y_train)
print("Accuracy: ", log_reg.score(X_test,y_test))

rf_reg = RandomForestClassifier(random_state=42)
rf_reg.fit(X_train, y_train)
print("Accuracy: ", rf_reg.score(X_test,y_test))

svm_clsf = SVC()
svm_clsf.fit(X_train, y_train)
print("Accuracy: ", svm_clsf.score(X_test,y_test))

best_knn = []
for n in range(1,12):
    knn = KNeighborsClassifier(n_neighbors=n)
    knn.fit(X_train, y_train)
    best_knn.insert(n, knn.score(X_test,y_test))
best_knn

knn_clsf = KNeighborsClassifier(n_neighbors=8)
knn_clsf.fit(X_train, y_train)
print("Accuracy: ", knn_clsf.score(X_test,y_test))

voting_classfication = VotingClassifier(estimators = [('knn', knn_clsf),('lg', log_reg), ('rfg', rf_reg), ('svc', svm_clsf)], voting="hard", n_jobs=-1)
voting_classfication.fit(X_train, y_train)
print("Accuracy: ", voting_classfication.score(X_test,y_test))

test_result = pd.Series(voting_classfication.predict(test), name = "Survived").astype(int)
results = pd.concat([test_data["PassengerId"], test_result],axis = 1)
results.to_csv("titanic_submission.csv", index = False)

# Chapter:1 Data Load And Check

## 1-Outlier Detection ![oie_384549KoGQkTap.png](attachment:oie_384549KoGQkTap.png) * Q1 = 1.Quartile 25% * Q2 = 2.Quartile 50% (median) * Q3 = 3.Quartile 75% * IQR = Q3 - Q1 * Outlier data = (Q1 - 1.5 IQR ) U (Q3 + 1.5 IQR)
## 2-Combining Train and Test Data * Train_data and test_data are combined so that data is obtained.

## 3-Feature Analysis Object 1. Name : 1. Sex : male and female 1. Ticket : ticket number 1. Cabin : cabin category 1. Embarked : port C, Q and S Int64 1. PassengerId : unique id number 1. Survived : 0 -> died ,1-> survived 1. Pclasss : 1, 2 and 3 1. SibSp : number of siblings/spouse 1. Parch : number of parent/children Float64 1. Age : age of passenger 1. Fare : price of the ticket
### Survived

# Chapter-3 Missing Value * Find Missing Value * Fill Missing Value

## 1-Find Missing Value * Age, Fare and Cabin have missing value. Therefore we are looking at the correlation matrix. Correlation Matrix * Pclass is associated with Fare. * Embarked is not associated with any feature. * Pclass and SibSp are associated with Age.
## 2-Fill Missing Value * Cabin has 1007 missing value * Age has 256 missing value * Embarked has 2 missing value * Fare has 1 missing value Not: Survived has 418 missing value (only test value)

### Fare Fill Value

Pclass is associated with Fare.

### Embarked Fill Value

Embarked is not associated with any feature.

S = 0,  C = 1 and Q = 2

### Age Fill Value

Pclass and SibSp are associated with Age.
